errors.error_description: The installation command incorrectly includes `yt` as a dependency, which is unnecessary.
correction_candidates: To install, run `pip install unyt`.
To install, run `conda install unyt yt`.
To install, run `pip install unyt --no-deps` and then `pip install yt`.
To install, run `pip install yt-project`.

errors.error_description: The file path for the yt project logo is incorrect, causing the image to be missing.
correction_candidates: Correct the image path to `https://raw.githubusercontent.com/yt-project/unyt/master/docs/_static/yt_logo_small.png`.
Correct the image path to `https://raw.githubusercontent.com/yt-project/unyt/main/docs/_static/yt_logo.png`.
Remove the image as it is not essential.
Correct the image path to `../docs/_static/yt_logo_small.png`.

errors.error_description: The README incorrectly states that the `sympy` dependency is optional, when in fact it is a required dependency.
correction_candidates: Change the text to 'This package only depends on ``numpy`` and ``sympy``.'
Change the text to 'This package depends on ``numpy`` and optionally on ``sympy`` for advanced features.'
Add installation instructions for optional dependencies: `pip install unyt[sympy]`
Change the text to 'This package has no external dependencies.'
errors.golden_answer: Change the text to 'This package only depends on ``numpy`` and ``sympy``.'

errors.error_description: The code example uses a non-existent method `.in_units()`. The correct method for unit conversion is `.to()`.
correction_candidates: Change `.in_units('km')` to `.to_base()`.
Change `.in_units('km')` to `.to('km')`.
Change `.in_units('km')` to `.convert('km')`.
Change `.in_units('km')` to `unyt.convert(arr, 'km')`.

errors.error_description: The manual installation instructions are in the wrong logical order, suggesting to install `unyt` before its dependency `numpy`.
correction_candidates: The dependencies are installed automatically. The section should be replaced with: `pip install unyt`.
First, install numpy using `pip install numpy`. Then, install unyt with `pip install unyt`.
Install all dependencies at once with `pip install unyt numpy sympy`.
Create a virtual environment, then run `pip install numpy unyt`.
errors.golden_answer: The dependencies are installed automatically. The section should be replaced with: `pip install unyt`.
